alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 12 at 10:12AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong line of rain showers will impact portions of southern Kennebec, Androscoggin, northwestern Lincoln and northwestern Sagadahoc Counties through 1100 AM EST... At 1010 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Livermore Falls to 7 miles southwest of Turner to Mechanic Falls. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Winthrop around 1030 AM EST. Lewiston and Manchester around 1040 AM EST. Hallowell around 1045 AM EST. Augusta, Topsham and Farmingdale around 1050 AM EST. Gardiner around 1055 AM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Dresden, Windsor, Wales, Sabattus, Fayette, Pittston, Poland, Chelsea, Bowdoin and Bowdoinham. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 30 and 51. Interstate 95 between mile markers 74 and 118. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding and abrupt low visibility. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; Southern Oxford
